newsitem.title: MEXICO: Mexican traffickers steal back drugs from cops.
newsitem.headline: Mexican traffickers steal back drugs from cops.

text.p: Presumed narco-traffickers broke into police headquarters in northern Mexico and stole nearly half a ton of cocaine that police had seized just days before, officials said on Friday.

The men forced their way in the local office of the attorney general's office early on Wednesday in the northern border town of San Luis Rio Colorado, across the border from Yuma, Arizona, police said.
Missing were some 1,045 pounds (473 kg) of cocaine, an armed guard and a woman in jail on drug possession charges.
"We do not know the whereabouts of either both persons or the cocaine," the attorney general's office (PGR) in the northern state of Sonora said in a statement on Friday.
Newspaper reports said on Friday police first found the drugs stashed in a small aircraft on May 13, arresting the pilot.
